Sisters In Cash

All Episodes

Looking for a podcast that speaks directly to the realities of being a content creator in the digital age? You’re in the right place. Every episode delivers unfiltered insights on content creation, copyright protection, monetization, legal pitfalls, and the smart use of AI and automation tools to scale your business with less burnout. Whether you’re growing your brand, protecting your content, or navigating platform changes — this podcast gives you the knowledge, tools, and real-life creator strategies to thrive.

Listen in, level up, and protect your brand.

Lina Marxsen

Lina Marxsen joins us to discuss essential strategies for content organization and recycling for adult creators, emphasizing how proper digital asset management directly impacts revenue and creator sustainability.

• Content recycling maximizes earnings by reusing material strategically without fans noticing

• Creating structured folders with detailed naming conventions makes content easily searchable later

• Authentic social media content performs better than forced "trendy" content that leads to burnout

• German creators should seek professional legal advice rather than relying on industry rumors

• Personal interaction with fans creates value that free content cannot provide

• Using AI as a virtual assistant can revolutionize content planning and business scaling

• When scaling, keep core fan interactions personal while considering assistance for photography and social media

Check out our Telegram and X communities for more strategies on effective AI prompting and content organization. Find access links on our Sisters in Cash social accounts.

Host: Jessica

Guest speakers IG handle: @lina-marxsen

This Episode is featured by LegalFans & 4based

Lina Marxsen

Lina Marxen discusses building her adult content business since 2022, sharing insights on platform management, content organization, and safety measures.

• Tracking traffic from different sources to understand where your audience comes from

• Creating separate accounts on different devices with distinct email addresses for platform safety

• Understanding platform Terms of Service to avoid account bans

• Using AI tools like ChatGPT and teleprompter apps to enhance content quality

• Implementing DMCA services with AI facial recognition to protect content

• Creating organized content management systems with searchable keywords

• Using Apple Notes and iCloud for efficient content organization

• Managing multiple platforms while maintaining separate accounts for safety

Check out next week's episode where Lina returns to discuss content cutting techniques and deeper platform safety measures.

Chrissy LeBlanc

Ever wondered what it takes to build a decade-long career in adult content creation? The Sisters in Cash podcast brings you an exclusive conversation with Chrissy LeBlanc, a powerhouse in the industry who's mastered the art of longevity in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. Recording live from Miami Expo, this candid discussion reveals the strategic thinking behind Chrissy's success as a live streamer, cam model, award-winning cosplayer, and model coach for Eplay. With refreshing honesty, she shares how she's navigated through potential burnout by periodically reinventing her approach across different platforms while maintaining her authentic brand.

One of the most valuable revelations comes when Chrissy explains her traffic generation strategy. Rather than spreading herself thin across multiple marketing channels, she leverages her live streaming as the cornerstone that drives fans to her other content outlets. Even more fascinating is her insight on collaborations: "I ended up turning some of her fans into my fans too," she explains, describing how partnering with other creators opened doors to entirely new audiences without traditional marketing efforts. The conversation takes a deep dive into how the industry has transformed, particularly in recent years. "The people coming into this industry now are more business savvy," Chrissy notes, highlighting the increased competition from newcomers who treat content creation as a legitimate career path rather than a side gig.

For established creators, this means constantly upping your game to stay relevant. When it comes to AI tools, Chrissy takes a nuanced position that many creators will find relatable. While she embraces AI for mundane tasks like writing content descriptions, she firmly rejects chatbots and automated interaction: "The big appeal with live streaming and getting content from an actual creator is that you're buying it from a real person with a real personality." This authenticity, she argues, is what truly differentiates creator content in an increasingly automated world. Whether you're an established content creator looking to refine your strategy or just curious about the business side of adult content, this episode delivers practical wisdom from someone who's weathered the industry's many changes. Subscribe now and join the Sisters in Cash community to access more insider knowledge from the creators who are defining the future of digital adult entertainment.

Host: Jessica

Guest speakers IG handle: @thechrissyleblanc

This Episode is featured by LegalFans & 4based

Char Borley

Char Borley, known as the "Dommy Mummy" in the industry and a Playboy CoverGirl with decades of experience, opens up about the darker side of content creation in today's digital landscape. When we caught up with her at XBiz Miami, she didn't hold back about the shocking reality many creators face today.

"I got scammed out of $168,000," Char reveals, describing her ongoing legal battle against a company that stole her content and is using it across their platforms without permission. What started as a six-figure theft has escalated i nto a million-dollar lawsuit as they've appropriated her entire brand and identity. Her experience highlights why content protection has become absolutely critical for creators, especially as AI technology makes content theft increasingly sophisticated and widespread.

The conversation takes a deep dive into the deceptive world of AI-generated profiles, with Char emphasizing that while the artificial images might look impressive, customers ultimately want authentic connections with real people. She warns about the dangerous new trend of companies slipping clauses into contracts allowing them to create AI versions of performers without additional compensation. "You have to take really care if you are signing some contracts now," she cautions, recommending specialized legal representation from industry experts who understand these evolving challenges.

For aspiring creators, Char offers invaluable insights on building a sustainable career. She manages a team of 15 people, emphasizing that outsourcing is essential to prevent burnout while maintaining a consistent online presence. From finding trustworthy assistants to navigating the increasingly restrictive social media landscape, her practical advice comes from years of trial and error. "Burnout is a real thing," she emphasizes, describing her approach of alternating between periods of intense activity and deliberate rest where her team takes over operations.

For aspiring creators, Char offers invaluable insights on building a sustainable career. She manages a team of 15 people, emphasizing that outsourcing is essential to prevent burnout while maintaining a consistent online presence. From finding trustworthy assistants to navigating the increasingly restrictive social media landscape, her practical advice comes from years of trial and error. "Burnout is a real thing," she emphasizes, describing her approach of alternating between periods of intense activity and deliberate rest where her team takes over operations.

Tanya Virago

We sit down with adult film actress Tanya Virago in Prague during her visit for the Vikings show where she plays a Valkyrie. Tanya shares insights about her work as a professional actress in the adult industry and the challenges content creators face with digital impersonation.

• Tanya primarily works with professional studios including Scorland and Evil Angel, preferring traditional shooting over webcam work

• Content theft and identity impersonation are significant issues, with scammers creating fake profiles to request content or money

• Protecting digital content requires vigilance, communication with colleagues, and specialized DMCA services like Legal Fans

• Real content created by actual performers represents genuine artistry that AI-generated content cannot replicate

• Upcoming public appearances include XBiz, Venus Berlin, and potentially a Viking World Gala event in Athens

Keep your eye on your content and don't hesitate to ask for help with protection. Everybody is in danger in today's digital environment, so please protect your content.

Lydia Black

The digital revolution in adult entertainment brings both unprecedented opportunities and concerning challenges for content creators. In this candid conversation with Lydia Black, a veteran adult performer who recently relocated from the US to Prague, we explore the often-hidden reality of AI rights being slipped into standard contracts without proper disclosure or compensation.

Lydia shares a revealing personal experience: "I've shown up on set looking over a contract I think I've looked over a million times. And all of a sudden there's AI rights in the contract." This concerning trend highlights the importance of creator vigilance in protecting their digital likeness and intellectual property. As companies rush to capitalize on AI technology, performers must stay informed about their rights and the potential long-term implications of signing away AI permissions.

Beyond the cautionary tales, we dive into the empowering side of technology for independent creators. Lydia explains how performers can leverage the same AI tools that management agencies use without surrendering their autonomy or revenue. From content organization to fan categorization, these technologies offer powerful advantages for savvy entrepreneurs. We also explore innovative revenue models like those offered by 4Based, where creators earn commission not just on their own content but from users they refer to the platform.

Beyond the cautionary tales, we dive into the empowering side of technology for i ndependent creators. Zuzu Sweet

Zuzu Sweet, a 28-year-old Czech creator, sits down with us amid the bustling energy of Prague's adult industry conference to share her remarkable journey from performer to innovative platform developer. This candid conversation reveals how savvy content creators are navigating the rapidly evolving digital landscape while maintaining creative independence.

The episode delves into the technological tools reshaping adult content creation. Zuzu and I explore specialized AI solutions designed specifically for adult creators—tools that help streamline content planning and production when mainstream options like ChatGPT remain restrictive. We share practical insights about how creators can protect their intellectual property using services like Legal Fans, which employs face-scanning technology to identify leaked content across the web.

What truly stands out is Zuzu's entrepreneurial vision. She details her upcoming platform launch, designed to address gaps she's identified in existing services, including integrated video calling capabilities. This represents the next evolution in creator empowerment—building the infrastructure rather than simply using it. We also discuss the stark contrast between collaborative creator communities in the US versus the more independent approach in Europe, highlighting how supportive networks can elevate everyone's success.

Both nominated for industry awards at the conference, we celebrate the growing recognition of the business acumen behind successful content creation. Whether you're in the adult industry or another creative field, this conversation offers valuable perspectives on maintaining independence, embracing technological innovation, and building community in an increasingly competitive digital landscape. Her story is not just about her career but also the broader changes in the industry, making it a compelling listen for anyone curious about adult entertainment.

Explore the pivotal shifts that have reshaped the industry landscape, particularly the impact of peer-to-peer torrent sites and the emergence of platforms like OnlyFans . Brittany offers insights into the challenges faced by content creators in an era marked by piracy and the pandemic's influence on the industry. Drawing parallels with the music industry's battle with Napster, she highlights the resilience and adaptability required to thrive. With her extensive experience, Brittany provides a unique perspective on how independent content creators can navigate these challenges and seize new opportunities.

Managing a multifaceted business in the adult entertainment world comes with its own set of complexities, and Brittany dives into the intricacies of content management and team building. From advanced storage systems to effective team strategies, Brittany's practical advice is invaluable for anyone in the industry. She emphasizes the importance of unity among female content creators, debunking the myth of constant competition, and shares tips on leveraging social media while dealing with shadow bans. Costina

Have you ever witnessed a star's ascent from social media stardom to the glitz of reality TV and beyond? Costina got Curves, the curvy model who's taken the world by storm, graces our show with her vibrant narrative, giving us the lowdown on her meteoric rise. From her early days captivating followers on Instagram to her gutsy pivot into the adult entertainment industry with Brazzers, Costina defies expectations. Alongside fellow model Ms. Jackson, she underscores the power of fostering supportive connections over competitive rivalries. She even teases us about her latest Austrian TV venture, proving her versatility and unwavering zeal for the spotlight.

They say fame is a beast, but our discussion with Costina peels back the layers, revealing the human side of the glimmering coin. We traverse the contours of stardom and the personal evolution that accompanies it, touching on the sobering reality of financial gambles and the exhilarating peaks of achievement. Costina's candid reflections on the balance between basking in adoration and shouldering the weight of public scrutiny provide an insightful glimpse into the life of someone in constant limelight. Through her journey, we celebrate the gradual respect garnered by adult entertainment professionals, akin to their mainstream counterparts, and how personal growth thrives amidst the pursuit of one's dreams.

Wrapping up our heart-to-heart, we shift focus to the digital realm – the pulsating heart of modern influence. Social media isn't just about the numbers; it's the community and authentic engagement that truly matter, a mantra Costina lives by. From the dizzying heights of Instagram to the whirlwind that is TikTok, we dissect the strategies that keep a creator afloat in the sea of content. Her transformative tale, from an airport counter clerk to a thriving model and influencer, serves as a beacon of empowerment for women everywhere. Embracing platforms like OnlyFans, Costina embodies the courage to break free from societal molds, encouraging all to wield self-belief as the ultimate tool for success. Join us for this riveting exploration into how self-assurance and digital savvy can redefine what it means to be a model in the modern age.

As we pivot to the burgeoning world of Telegram, Kim Judge paints a vivid picture of its vast networking and promotional landscape, ideal for adult industry professionals seeking new avenues for community engagement. This untapped resource boasts features unparalleled by other messaging apps, fostering a dynamic space for creators to grow their brand and connect with like-minded individuals. The discussion provides a roadmap for navigating Telegram's channels and groups, essential for anyone looking to create or amplify their business opportunities in this niche market.

Wrapping up the episode, we get practical with Kim Judge, delving into the art of balancing personal and professional interactions on Telegram, a must-hear for anyone juggling multiple facets of their online persona. We dissect the art of monetizing and engaging with a broader audience on the platform, providing actionable strategies for buying and selling shoutouts and creating monetizable channels. Kim's candidness and generosity in sharing her knowledge make this episode a beacon for content creators seeking to push the boundaries of their promotional efforts and establish a formidable presence in the adult industry.

Jose reveals the driving concept of ModernSearcher.com, a space that gives creators the leverage to promote their content unrestricted. We delve into the SEO-centric approach of the platform and how models can carve a visibility niche for themselves through consistent posting.

Intrigued about promoting your OnlyFans content with ease? Jose spills the beans on how Model Searcher simplifies this by enabling models to promote their OnlyFans accounts effortlessly. We discuss the potential hazards with platforms like Instagram and furnish insights into the verification process on Model Searcher. Jose then teases upcoming plans to expand and refine the platform, hinting at a future where this tool could transform the industry.

As we unwrap the conversation, we uncover the multitude of benefits that models and agencies in the adult industry can reap from ModelSearcher. Jose talks about the targeted traffic the platform draws from OnlyFans users and how it paves the way for higher conversion rates. He also discusses how agencies can manage multiple models seamlessly. Despite the unpredictability of Instagram, we believe ModelSearcher offers stability, potential, and the freedom to promote diverse platforms and projects. Don't miss this enlightening conversation as we uncover the value of ModelSearcher.

Stefan Muehlbauer

Ever wondered how you can turn your passion for speaking into a thriving career? Join our riveting discussion with Stefan Muehlbauer, the force behind two successful podcasts and a book demystifying the Affiliate industry. Also known as Affpal, Stefan enlightens us on his journey from the stage to affiliate management and business development, and how he leverages his podcasts as a personal branding tool and lead converter.

This episode is a deep dive into Stefan's unique approach to podcasting and his innovative educational program designed to help others understand and thrive in the performance marketing industry. He shares invaluable insights into the industry, highlighting the urgent need for companies to provide substantial support to new employees and adopt direct and succinct communication. We also unpack his experiences from various international conferences and how these have shaped his networking and conferred a unique approach to on-the-spot podcasting.

Further into the conversation, Stefan shared his experiences with monetizing content on social media platforms, he reveals how he strikes a balance between creating content that resonates with him and staying within his niche. As the discussion winds down, he talks about his journey towards charging for his services, the encouragement he got from peers, and the lessons from his decade-long journey in the industry. This episode is a treasure trove of wisdom for anyone interested in performance marketing, affiliate management, and podcasting. Tune in for an enlightening conversation with Stefan Muehlbauer!

Esluna Love

What would it be like to transition from alternative modeling to creating your own captivating content? This episode features the inspiring story of Esluna Love, a dynamic creator who has been navigating the industry for years. Esluna’s journey has taken her from modeling, to professional movies, to webcamming, and to the point where she's now masterfully crafting her own content. She’s been enjoying a wave of success on YouTube, where she and her team have been churning out engaging vlogs. Get ready to soak in some of Esluna’s personal tips, including the power of consistency, clever use of hashtags, and the art of intelligent scheduling.

Ever wondered about the importance of networking and relationship building in the creator industry? Esluna sheds light on why it is crucial to step out of your comfort zone, attend conventions, and build strong relationships. Yes, it can be overwhelming, especially if you're an introvert. But Esluna assures that the experience is priceless, and there are few things that compare to the thrill of shooting in different countries or getting nominated at a show. The journey is worth it, and it's all about personal growth.

Lastly, we dive into traffic generation and social media strategy. Esluna shares her thoughts on the power of Snapchat, TikTok, and Reels in driving traffic and establishing a personal brand. She believes in connecting with fans at a personal level, creating a bond that can help your content go viral. We also discuss navigating the creator industry with authenticity and setting personal boundaries. Tune in, and get ready to immerse yourself in a wealth of knowledge from Esluna's experiences and insights. This is an episode you won’t want to miss!

Thorsten Heim

Join us as we sit down with industry expert Thorsten Heim, widely known as Thor, in our latest episode of Sisters in Cash. With a compelling 20-year journey under his belt, Thor takes us on a ride through the intricate world of media buying. Right from the old-school banner days in Germany to current advancements in buying traffic for platforms like Only Fans, Thor’s experiences are nothing short of enlightening.

Ever wondered how you can elevate your online presence? Learn as Thor unveils the art and science behind media buying and his strategies for traffic acquisition. Be in the know of the potential rewards and associated risks, and discover how to make prudent decisions on whether a platform or shout out is worth your hard-earned money. Thor also highlights the essence of tracking conversions and cost per acquisition, two key metrics that can determine the success or failure of your media buying efforts.

As we navigate the conversation, Thor takes us on a tour of some different platforms - illustrating how models can harness the power of media buying to promote their profiles. From networking at industry events to leveraging various social media platforms, Thor provides a wealth of insights on the path to success in an increasingly digital world. So gear up for an insightful ride into the realm of media buying with our industry veteran, Thorsten Heim.

Summary & Credits

Lina Marxsen joins us to discuss essential strategies for content organization and recycling for adult creators, emphasizing how proper digital asset management directly impacts revenue and creator sustainability.

• Content recycling maximizes earnings by reusing material strategically without fans noticing • Creating structured folders with detailed naming conventions makes content easily searchable later • Authentic social media content performs better than forced "trendy" content that leads to burnout • German creators should seek professional legal advice rather than relying on industry rumors • Personal interaction with fans creates value that free content cannot provide • Using AI as a virtual assistant can revolutionize content planning and business scaling • When scaling, keep core fan interactions personal while considering assistance for photography and social media

Check out our Telegram and X communities for more strategies on effective AI prompting and content organization. Find access links on our Sisters in Cash social accounts.

Host: Jessy

Summary & Credits

Ever wondered what it takes to build a decade-long career in adult content creation? The Sisters in Cash podcast brings you an exclusive conversation with Chrissy LeBlanc, a powerhouse in the industry who's mastered the art of longevity in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. Recording live from Miami Expo, this candid discussion reveals the strategic thinking behind Chrissy's success as a live streamer, cam model, award-winning cosplayer, and model coach for Eplay. With refreshing honesty, she shares how she's navigated through potential burnout by periodically reinventing her approach across different platforms while maintaining her authentic brand. One of the most valuable revelations comes when Chrissy explains her traffic generation strategy. Rather than spreading herself thin across multiple marketing channels, she leverages her live streaming as the cornerstone that drives fans to her other content outlets. Even more fascinating is her insight on collaborations: "I ended up turning some of her fans into my fans too," she explains, describing how partnering with other creators opened doors to entirely new audiences without traditional marketing efforts. The conversation takes a deep dive into how the industry has transformed, particularly in recent years. "The people coming into this industry now are more business savvy," Chrissy notes, highlighting the increased competition from newcomers who treat content creation as a legitimate career path rather than a side gig. For established creators, this means constantly upping your game to stay relevant. When it comes to AI tools, Chrissy takes a nuanced position that many creators will find relatable. While she embraces AI for mundane tasks like writing content descriptions, she firmly rejects chatbots and automated interaction: "The big appeal with live streaming and getting content from an actual creator is that you're buying it from a real person with a real personality." This authenticity, she argues, is what truly differentiates creator content in an increasingly automated world. Whether you're an established content creator looking to refine your strategy or just curious about the business side of adult content, this episode delivers practical wisdom from someone who's weathered the industry's many changes. Subscribe now and join the Sisters in Cash community to access more insider knowledge from the creators who are defining the future of digital adult entertainment.

Host: Jessy

Guest speakers IG handle: @andywullmer

This Episode is featured by LegalFans & 4based
